The #LOSAL App has special features for verified members of the Los Alamitos High School community.

Thanks\! You will receive a text message from (562) 320-8034. Click the text link to complete the process.
No text message? Email us and we\'ll see what the deal is, or click \"retry\" below.
and we\'ll see what the deal is, or click \"retry\" below.

The #LOSAL APP uses Localism! to protect your privacy and unite our community. Your private information is not shared.

The #LOSAL APP is managed as a service of Localism Inc. using the Localism! Community Engagement Platform (CEP). Localism! is connecting and empowering local organizations through community-centric technology. \nLearn more at Localism.co/schools
We want to make the #LOSAL APP the #BestAppEver! Have an idea? Email us!

If you\'re having issues with the app or not sure how to use it, please email us and describe the issue in detail. Please mention your phone\'s make and model (such as HTC One or Apple iPhone 5c) and your carrier (i.e., AT&T or Verizon). This info will help us trouble-shoot the issue.
Do you need to report an emergency\? \nClick to call 911 now.

Not an emergency\? 
If you see something, say something: 
Call 562-391-2193 to reach Los Al USD's campus safety.

#LOSAL APP security 
This app is built on Localism's CEP and has the following security features: Only members of the school community who have been verified have full access to app content (level 1 access). This level of access only displays students using an obfuscated "persona" format (avatar, first name and last initial), and the posts do not link to the students' real social media profiles. 
For posts to appear in the app, they must be: 
- Photos that are already publicly available on the internet from Twitter, Instagram or Facebook 
- Tagged with #losal 
- Submitted by verified students (in-person verification at school) 
- From students who have successfully completed two-factor authentication for their smartphone


Level 2 access is for verified parents, faculty and staff. Verification for adults includes in-person verification, and two-factor smartphone authentication. Adults have the ability to see all posts and the obfuscated persona of the student, but they do not have the ability to "like" or "favorite" posts.


Level 3 access is for non-verified app users. They only see a photo wall in the social feed. They do not see textual content of posts or the obfuscated persona.


Privacy and server security 
Localism Inc.'s CEP is 100% FERPA-compliant meeting or exceeding applicable provisions of the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA), 20 U.S.C. 1232g. Privacy and security measures are in place to protect user data and data transfer. The privacy and security of student data is our first priority. See our privacy policy for more information. 

Privacy policy (English)

How can I post to the app\? 
Verified students must do three things before posting to the app\: 
- Get verified at school (such as registration) 
- Confirm their phone by clicking a confirmation text message 
- Set their persona (avatar, etc.) 
- Activate at least one supported social network (only Twitter and Instagram are supported in this version, with Facebook to follow).


Can parents submit posts to the app\? 
No, the social feed would probably be filled with parent posts and drown out student posts. That said, a "parents corner" may be added to the app if there is interest. You can vote for this feature and suggest others by emailing us!

Can teachers submit posts to the app\? 
We are planning on it, and students have requested it. If you have want to voice your opinion, email us.


Can the school see my other posts? 
No. In fact only public posts that have been specifically tagged with #losal enter the system. The system does not index private posts. That would be creepy!


I made a post and submitted it by tagging it with #losal, but it didn't appear on the social feed. What gives\? 
A variety of factors give more weight to post, and only posts that surpass a threshold are displayed in the feed. Weighting factors can include the amount of likes and relevance to selected campus keywords. Additionally the platform ignores posts that contain common NSFS terms (Not Safe For School). The purpose of the social feed is to connect the campus with posts from students about school life and activities. The algorithm and automatic filtering has been tuned to yield these results.
The #LOSAL App can be reset, which takes it back to the start screen and requests a mobile number for verification. Click here to reset.
